member.name: T:s4pi.Filetable.GameFoldersForm
member.summary: Provides a common control for enabling editing of the install locations of game folders.
member.remarks: Note that it is left to the containing application to pass values between this form and the Filetable. This is to allow any additional processing, such as storing user preferences, to be handled.

member.name: T:s4pi.Filetable.GameFolders
member.summary: Provides access to the XML definition of game folder default locations and the resultant list of known games.

remarks.para: When using this class - which is depended upon by - ensure the file GameFolders.xml is present in the same folder as the assembly containing this class as it is used to specify a number of configuration values. These are as follows:

item.description: Root element of the file, defines the XML namespace used.
The folder to use when no <rootfolder> tag applies. If this value is also not found, a value of / is used.

A search is performed for a matching entry based on the vendor and os attributes:
attributevalues
vendor .OSVersion (see ) .Platform (see ) is used to determine whether the vendor is MacOSX, Unix or (otherwise) Microsoft.
os 64bit, or 32bit when the size of is 4 bytes.

description.para: This is a container for details about a specific Sims3 game. It has two attributes:

item.description: baseGame (the base game itself), EP (a full expansion pack) or SP (a stuff pack). The value is not used.

Exposed as and used internally (e.g. to determine where delta build packages are found) as well as by the . The value is expected to match the top five "version" bits of the (hence RGVersion) of certain resources.

description.para: The following tags appear for each game:

item.description: The identity of the game, used for the list of EPs Disabled (see ).
A descriptive name for the section.
(English-language) default install folder for the game.
Whether the game is disabled by default; the value not-allowed means the game will always be enabled.

Optional tag to allow extra an EA content package to be added for this that is otherwise not found. Multiple occurrences are supported. It is expected only to be required if EA change the naming scheme and a library update has not been issued to cater for the change. This is not directly exposed but all values are prepended to , and - see remarks for more details.

remarks.para: The "root folder" for the installation is determined by:

list.item: finding the <defaultrootfolder> tag exists and is a valid folder; or

remarks.para: The EA packages for a are found relative to the folder either specified in , or the <DefaultInstallDir> tag value for the <game> - i.e. the value returned by .

member.summary: Return the folder where the given is installed.

member.summary: Returns whether a specified is enabled.
member.param: The to query.

member.summary: The list of s defined in the GameFolders.xml file.

member.summary: A semi-colon delimited string of game name / install folder pairs, internally delimited by an equals sign.

member.name: P:s4pi.Filetable.GameFolders.EPsDisabled
member.summary: A semi-colon delimited string of EP and SP names that the user has stated should not be referenced by the vendor part of the view.

member.name: T:s4pi.Filetable.Game
member.summary: Represents a known game object.

remarks.para: , and all return enumerations of paths based on EA's known behaviour for distributing EPs and SPs. If this changes to a method not supported (see below), the <ExtraPackage> tag for the <game> can be used - see remarks for details.
For and , one of the following values is returned:

list.item: If no is known, return only the <ExtraPackage> paths.
Otherwise, return the <ExtraPackage> paths, delta packages and the appropriate fullbuild (0 for ; 2 for ).

remarks.para: Delta packages are found under the + "GameData\Shared\DeltaPackages". This is searched for each sub-folder named "pXX" (where "XX" is the deltabuild number - assumed for the timebeing to have 32 as the highest value). Within each sub-folder, the package named "Deltabuild_pXX.package" is added to the list, if found.

list.item: For games other than the basegame, any packages matching "FullBuild*.package" are added to the list.
For the basegame, DeltaBuildX.package and FullBuildX.package (where X is 0 for ; 2 for ) are added to the list.

remarks.para: For , one of the following values is returned:

list.item: If no is known, return only the <ExtraPackage> paths.
Otherwise, return the <ExtraPackage> paths and any packages matching "*Thumbnails.package" under + "Thumbnails".

member.summary: Returns the ConfigApplicationPath Windows registry value for this EP/SP (or null).

member.name: P:s4pi.Filetable.Game.DefaultInstallDir
member.summary: The default installation location, relative to the determined root folder.
member.remarks: See remarks for details of how "root folder" is determined.

member.name: P:s4pi.Filetable.Game.InstallDir
member.summary: The full path to where we think the EP/SP is installed unless overriden.

member.summary: The for this .

member.summary: Whether the supplied XML indicates this game is suppressed.
member.remarks: The value is null if the user should not be able to disable this game.

member.summary: The state for this .
